results.title: Timer trigger for Azure Functions
results.description: The @TimerTrigger annotation on the function defines the schedule using the same string format as CRON expressions. An NCRONTAB expression is similar to a CRON expression except that it includes an additional sixth field at the beginning to use for time precision in seconds: {second} {minute} {hour} {day} {month} {day-of-week} Each field can have.

results.title: Configure schedules to run pipelines - Azure Pipelines
results.description: To delete UI scheduled triggers from a YAML pipeline, see UI settings override YAML scheduled... Scheduled triggers configure a pipeline to run on a schedule defined using cron syntax. Scheduled pipelines in YAML have the following constraints. The time zone for cron schedules is UTC. You can get AI assistance from GitHub Copilot to create your.

results.title: Jobs in Azure Container Apps
results.description: A process that generates financial reports nightly Job Use the Schedule job type and configure a cron expression. Container Apps jobs use cron expressions to define schedules. They support the standard cron expression format with f... Here are some examples of cron expressions: Expression Description */5 * * * * Runs every 5 minutes. 0 */2 * * *.
